template.name: GM DDMI
template.description:
## Description
Monitor HP transceivers
## Overview
Low Level Discovery (LLD) for HP transceivers (switches) monitoring (gbic DDM DDMI DOM).
Attention: You will want to have a regular expression called @isFiberTransceiver to filter out cooper gbics (stacking, etc)
oid .1.3.6.1.4.1.25506.2.70.1.1.1.1
Triggers are created with thresholds given by gbic.
Temperature, voltage, bias, serial, hardware type, fiber diameter, status, dbm, db, transmit power, receive power.
## Author
Rafael Gustavo Gassner

item_prototype.name: Bias on interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the current bias electric current. The unit is in hundredths of mA

item_prototype.name: Bias High Alarm interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Transceiver bias high alarm threshold limit in microamps.

item_prototype.name: Bias Low Alarm interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Transceiver bias low alarm threshold limit in microamps.

item_prototype.name: Current received power of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the current received power. The unit is in hundredths of dBM.

item_prototype.name: Current transmitted power of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the current transmitted power. The unit is in hundredths of dBM.

item_prototype.name: Availability of diagnostics in interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the digital diagnostic monitoring function.

item_prototype.name: Transceiver error of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Bitmask indicating transceiver errors. Transceiver information I/O error(0) Transceiver information checksum error(1) Transceiver type and port configuration mismatch(2) Transceiver type not supported by port hardware(3) WIS local fault(4) Receive optical power fault(5) PMA/PMD receiver local fault(6) PCS receive local fault(7) PHY XS receive local fault(8) Laser bias current fault(9) Laser temperature fault(10) Laser output power fault(11) TX fault(12) PMA/PMD transmitter local fault(13) PCS transmit local fault(14) PHY XS Transmit Local Fault(15) RX loss of signal(16) Unused(17-31)

item_prototype.name: Fiber diameter type of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: The diameter of the fiber, measured in micron. fiber9 - 9 micron multi-mode fiber fiber50 - 50 micron multi-mode fiber fiber625 - 62.5 micron multi-mode fiber copper - copper cable.

item_prototype.name: Hardware type of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Hardware type of the interface, such as SM(single mode).

item_prototype.name: Maximum received power of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the maximum received power. The unit is in hundredths of dBM.

item_prototype.name: Maximum transmitted power of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the maximum transmitted power. The unit is in hundredths of dBM.

item_prototype.name: Minimum received power of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the minimum received power. The unit is in hundredths of dBM.

item_prototype.name: Minimum transmitted power of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the minimum transmitted power. The unit is in hundredths of dBM.

item_prototype.name: Serial number of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Serial number of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Temperature interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the current temperature. The unit is Celsius centigrade.

item_prototype.name: Temperature High Alarm interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Transceiver temperature high alarm threshold limit in thousandths of degrees Celsius. As an example: 49120 is 49.120 degrees Celsius.

item_prototype.name: Temperature Low Alarm interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Transceiver temperature low alarm threshold limit in thousandths of degrees Celsius. As an example: 49120 is 49.120 degrees Celsius.

item_prototype.name: Transfer distance of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: The maximum distance which the interface can transmit, measured in meter.

item_prototype.name: Transceiver type of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Type of the interface, such as SFP/XFP/GBIC.

item_prototype.name: VCC High Alarm interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Transceiver VCC high alarm threshold limit in hundreds of microvolts. As an example: 32928 is 3.2928 volts. Returns zero if not supported on the transceiver.

item_prototype.name: VCC Low Alarm interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Transceiver VCC low alarm threshold limit in hundreds of microvolts. As an example: 32928 is 3.2928 volts. Returns zero if not supported on the transceiver.

item_prototype.name: Vendor name of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Vendor name of the interface.

item_prototype.name: Transceiver Voltage $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Indicating the current voltage. The unit is in hundredths of V

item_prototype.name: Wave Length of interface $1#{#DESCRIPTION}#{#ALIAS}
item_prototype.description: Wave length of the interface, measured in nanometer.

trigger_prototype.name: Current RX Power is higher than the maximum threshold on transceiver {ITEM.VALUE1} {ITEM.VALUE2}. Current RX Power is {ITEM.VALUE3}. Maximum RX power should be {ITEM.VALUE4}. Equipment {HOST.HOST}
Current RX Power is lower than the minimum threshold on transceiver {ITEM.VALUE1} {ITEM.VALUE2}. Current RX Power is {ITEM.VALUE3}. Minimum RX power should be {ITEM.VALUE4}. Equipment {HOST.HOST}
trigger_prototype.description: This happens when there is no fiber connected.

trigger_prototype.name: Current TX Power is higher than the maximum threshold on transceiver {ITEM.VALUE1} {ITEM.VALUE2}. Current TX Power is {ITEM.VALUE3}. Maximum TX power should be {ITEM.VALUE4}. Equipment {HOST.HOST}
Current TX Power is lower than the minimum threshold on transceiver {ITEM.VALUE1} {ITEM.VALUE2}. Current TX Power is {ITEM.VALUE3}. Minimum TX power should be {ITEM.VALUE4}. Equipment {HOST.HOST}
Temperature is too high on transceiver {ITEM.VALUE1} {ITEM.VALUE2}. Current temperature is {ITEM.VALUE3}. Maximum temperature should be {ITEM.VALUE4}. Equipment {HOST.HOST}
Temperature is too low on transceiver {ITEM.VALUE1} {ITEM.VALUE2}. Current temperature is {ITEM.VALUE3}. Lower temperature should be {ITEM.VALUE4}. Equipment {HOST.HOST}
